poem:
"Reshuffling Cards in the Deck of Knowledge"

In the hallowed halls of Turing's keep, 
Four men ascend as others sleep.
An AI dawn, yet shadows creep,
Hinting at convictions deep.
In unturned pages, letters leap,
Upon the slate of diversity's steep,
They sound a plea, strong yet meek.
In the wisdom that we seek,
Diversity must speak.
